description: Clerical patterns for whitelisting same-day/retroactive hearing reschedules that are corrections rather than violations

patterns.name: Retroactive time-shortened same-day correction
patterns.description: Hearing rescheduled recorded retroactively (after hearing occurred) with prior valid notice (10+ days) with same-day time change. Consistently classified as clerical correction rather than violation based on domain expert review.
patterns.reviewer_notes: Consistently seen with hearings that ran shorter than planned. Staff updates the public record after the fact to reflect actual times.

patterns.name: Virtual option added retroactively
patterns.description: Hearing rescheduled announced same day as hearing with prior valid notice (10+ days) adding virtual option. Consistently classified as clerical correction rather than violation based on domain expert review.
patterns.reviewer_notes: Common when committees decide to enable virtual attendance on short notice and update the record. Original in-person notice was timely.

patterns.name: Room/location correction after hearing
patterns.description: Hearing rescheduled announced same day as hearing with prior valid notice (10+ days). Consistently classified as clerical correction rather than violation based on domain expert review.
patterns.reviewer_notes: Announced for one room (e.g., A-1) but actually held in another (e.g., A-2). Record updated to match what happened. Time remained the same.

patterns.name: End time updated day-after (hearing shortened)
patterns.description: Hearing rescheduled recorded retroactively (after hearing occurred) with prior valid notice (10+ days). Consistently classified as clerical correction rather than violation based on domain expert review.
patterns.reviewer_notes: Hearing scheduled until 5PM but committee finished at 3PM. Next day, record updated to reflect actual end time.

application_rules.notes: Patterns with confidence >= minimum_confidence are automatically applied. Patterns with confidence >= human_review_threshold but < minimum_confidence are flagged for quick review with suggested determination.

metadata.notes: This is an example configuration. Real patterns should be generated from actual expert reviews using tools/analyze_clerical_patterns.py
